reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Providing Protection and WASH services to people affected by COVID-19 in NW Syria

description.narrative:
This project aims to provide 213,242 BNFs with WASH and Protection services to affected people with a high focus on COVID-19 and quarantine centers in Al-Bab, Daret Azza, Atareb, sub-districts to support the resilience and access to services considering the full and strict application of COVID-19 prevention precautions according to the recommendations of WHO. The project's interventions have put a strong emphasis on providing emergency WASH and protection services that can meet the different needs of men, women, boys, and girls with full consideration of the specific needs of the most vulnerable groups women, children, elderly, and people with a disability with full application of COVID-19 prevention measures to support the affected communities by delivering aid through experienced staff who already implemented similar projects in the same locations and gained the acceptance as follow:
8 quarantine and isolation centers will be served by both WASH and Protection integrated services as a response to COVID-19 and provide a safe environment to affected people as follow: Support quarantined people with hygiene kits
Provision of information and PFA to quarantined people including elderly, PWDs, and individuals at risk Provide group-based PSS to quarantined people. Strengthening of community support for quarantine and isolation centers through establishing community committees in each location Provide awareness-raising sessions for individuals in quarantine in protection, CP, and GBV. Identification and referrals for specific needs and concerns along with receiving referrals from C19 helplines. Case management for CP and GBV affected people with high risk and concerns in quarantine centers. Distribution of PSS kits to children, and dignity kits to girls and women inside quarantine centers. Build the capacity of the quarantine center’s health staff on protection principles, identification and referrals, and GBV key messages. The intervention will continue targeting the affected communities with both WASH and Protection services through, provision of diesel fuel, engine oil, and spare parts (diesel filters, oil filters, air filters for generator), in addition to the provision of Sodium Hypochlorite, or liquid chlorine, which qualified staff will add it to the water supply via the chlorine dosing pumps for operating and maintenance of the 16 water stations belong to Al-Bab water system for two months until completion of connecting the stations to the electrical network. On the other hand, the community-based protection will be enhanced through the establishment of community committees to deliver prevention services in line with COVID-19 prevention measures Repair existing WASH facilities including replacement of malfunctioned handwashing basins, taps, showers, toilet seats. Provision of safe and adequate water Installation of handwashing units Provision of desludging or connect to existing wastewater collection if needed. Provision of solid waste collection, separation, and disposal services with attention to a sanitary disposal system Support WASH facilities with cleaning materials and tools Support frontline workers with PPE kits Strengthening of community support for quarantine center through establishing community committees in each location Provision of PFA, PSS, and Awareness-raising sessions to affected communities through emphasizing community-based protection. The mentioned services will be delivered through 4 protection mobile teams (1 in Dana, 1 Daret Azza, 1 Atareb, 1 Al-Bab) and 2 WASH site engineers and 2 field officers, with close coordination with COVID-19 TF, MHPSS WG, and Health cluster and directorate and the governorship of Gaziantep, along with the flexibility to shift to the online protection services provider.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
